basic.desc: The basic elements are the most primary ones such as rectangles, texts and images.

input-control.desc: The input elements represent all the elements allowing the user to give information to the system.

special.desc: The special elements are those that directly have native apecs such as animations, complex designs, etc.

layout.desc: The layout elements are those responsible for positioning other elements in the form of tables, columns, etc.

navigation.desc: The navigation elements allow you to define routes in your project. This allows you to move from one view or page to another.

networkelement.desc: Network elements are media elements whose sources come from the Internet or any other network.

animation.desc: The animation element are element whose allows you to associate with an child element animation for different events.

multimedia.desc: Multimedia comes in many different formats. It can be almost anything you can hear or see, like images, music, sound, videos, records, films, animations, and more.

game.desc: The game's element are element whose allows you to create 2D game.

atscript.desc: Artefact uses JavaScript as a scripting language for setting up functions, events, signals ... But it is a slightly modified version with a number of new rules..
